title: [Large-Scale] Advanced Financial Analysis Competency Online Training Considering Social Responsibility and Management Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of financial theory and accounting principles, business analysis experience, foundational understanding of economic, political, and institutional environments, elementary knowledge of corporate social responsibility (CSR) and sustainability concepts, and awareness of global economic trends and social relational structures
context.additional_context: A course targeting corporate managers/leaders to enhance practical financial analysis capabilities. Conducted in asynchronous learning environments using digital devices, emphasizing analytical competencies considering organizational decision-making processes and corporate social responsibility (CSR) elements. Aims to cultivate comprehensive decision-making skills based on understanding global economic changes and corporate social roles. Strengthens connectivity with social institutions through case analyses incorporating historical examples and geographical contexts throughout the curriculum.

learning_goals: Learners must accurately calculate five financial ratios (current ratio, debt ratio, ROE, ROA, operating profit margin) from Samsung Electronics, Hyundai Motor, and LG Chem’s financial statements, identify ≥3 patterns in cash flow activities (operating/investing/financing), and write a one-page report (40% analysis, 40% decision rationale, 20% CSR strategy) justifying economic decisions for given scenarios (equipment investment/debt repayment/dividend policy). The report must score ≥80% on the provided rubric (accuracy 30%, logic 30%, CSR integration 20%, format compliance 20%) and include corporate citizenship responsibilities and SDGs alignment.

Learners must design an ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance)-integrated decision-making process for three investment scenarios (short/medium/long-term) in a virtual trading simulation, produce an analysis report linking management strategies to ≥10% ROI and ≥70 SII (Social Impact Index), and incorporate politico-economic contexts considering stakeholders’ (investors, communities, government) rights and expectations.

Learners must collaborate with three team members to analyze a company’s financial data (revenue, costs, profits), create a ≤10-page report with three visualizations (bar/line/pi charts), and present two management strategies (economic efficiency + social impact) in a 5-minute presentation to key stakeholders (executives, investors, community representatives). The presentation must include cultural responsibility and community development plans.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
